member.name: T:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.CustomApskRing
member.summary: This class contains the settings for one Custom APSK ring.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.CustomApskRing.IsRingEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to include the ring in analysis.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.CustomApskRing.IsRingValid
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the configuration of the ring is valid relative to all other rings. Rings with invalid configurations are automatically excluded from analysis (see ).

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.CustomApskRing.Magnitude
member.summary: Gets or sets the Magnitude (radius) for a single Custom APSK ring.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.CustomApskRing.NumberOfStates
member.summary: Gets or sets the Number Of States for a single Custom APSK ring.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.CustomApskRing.Phase
member.summary: Gets or sets the Phase offset for a single Custom APSK ring.

member.name: T:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.CustomApskRingCollection
member.summary: This collection contains the set of objects representing the settings for each Custom APSK ring.

member.summary: Specifies the mode of the digital-demodulation adaptive equalizer.

member.summary: Equalizer filter taps will adapt with each measurement update.

member.name: F:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.EqualizerMode.Hold
member.summary: Equalizer filter taps will remain static with each measurement update.

member.name: T:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.CpmIndex
member.summary: Specifies the modulation index parameters used by CPM (FM) modulation analysis. In some cases, two values are used {h1,H2} representing a shift in modulation index on consecutive symbol-times. In other cases, only a single value {h1} is used for all symbol-times.

member.name: F:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.CpmIndex.TwelveSixteenthsAndThirteenSixteenths
member.summary: Specifies the CPM modulation index values {h1, h2} = {12/16, 13/16}.

member.name: F:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.CpmIndex.SevenSixteenthsAndTenSixteenths
member.summary: Specifies the CPM modulation index values {h1, h2} = {7/16, 10/16}.

member.name: F:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.CpmIndex.SixSixteenthsAndSevenSixteenths
member.summary: Specifies the CPM modulation index values {h1, h2} = {6/16, 7/16}.

member.name: F:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.CpmIndex.FiveSixteenthsAndSixSixteenths
member.summary: Specifies the CPM modulation index values {h1, h2} = {5/16, 6/16}.

member.name: F:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.CpmIndex.FourSixteenthsAndFiveSixteenths
member.summary: Specifies the CPM modulation index values {h1, h2} = {4/16, 5/16}.

member.name: F:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.CpmIndex.MinimumShiftKeying
member.summary: Specifies the CPM modulation index value h1 = 1/2 (h2 is not defined).

member.name: F:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.CpmIndex.Apco25Phase2
member.summary: Specifies the CPM modulation index values h1 = 1/3 (h2 is not defined).

member.name: T:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.NormalizationReference
member.summary: Reference used for normalization of IQ results and EVM.

member.name: F:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.NormalizationReference.ConstellationMaximum
member.summary: Normalize so that the outer-most corners of the constellation have a magnitude of one. For cross-QAM constellations, the outer-most corners of the square are used even though they are not really constellation points.

member.name: F:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.NormalizationReference.ReferenceRms
member.summary: Normalize so that IQ Reference trace has an RMS level of one.

member.name: T:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.UserFilterValidation
member.summary: Response values from validation of a data register as a UserFilter.

member.name: F:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.UserFilterValidation.Valid
member.summary: Data register can be used as a UserFilter

member.name: F:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.UserFilterValidation.NullNotValid
member.summary: Data register cannot be used as a UserFilter, data register is null

member.name: F:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.UserFilterValidation.EmptyNotValid
member.summary: Data register cannot be used as a UserFilter, data register is empty

member.name: F:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.UserFilterValidation.NoDataObjectNotValid
member.summary: Data register cannot be used as a UserFilter, data register has no data object

member.name: F:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.UserFilterValidation.ZeroPointsNotValid
member.summary: Data register cannot be used as a UserFilter, data register has zero Points

member.name: F:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.UserFilterValidation.NoMetadataNotValid
member.summary: Data register cannot be used as a UserFilter, data register has no metadata

member.name: F:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.UserFilterValidation.DataMarkedInvalidNotValid
member.summary: Data register cannot be used as a UserFilter, data register data is invalid

member.name: F:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.UserFilterValidation.DataComplexNotValid
member.summary: Data register cannot be used as a UserFilter, data register data is complex

member.name: F:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.UserFilterValidation.DataDomainNotValid
member.summary: Data register cannot be used as a UserFilter, data register not time domain

member.name: T:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension
member.summary: The DigDemod object contains properties and members to control the digital demodulation measurement feature.
member.remarks: The DigDemod object provides access to the analyzer's digital demodulation measurement features. The digital demodulation display features are controlled through the Trace object. For more information, see the VSA application "About Option AYA: Digital Modulation Analysis" help topic. Digital demodulation features are only available if Option AYA is installed.

member.name: M:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.CastToExtensionType(System.Object)
member.summary: This method casts the supplied object to the type. Some tools are unable to use the generic methods provided on class so this is provided as an alternative.
member.param: The object to be cast to the measurement extension type.
member.returns: A correctly cast handle of type , or null if the cast failed.

member.name: M:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.ExtensionType
member.summary: Returns the type for instances this measurement extension. Some tools are unable to use the generic methods provided on class so this is provided as an alternative.

member.name: M:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.EqualizerReset
member.summary: Gets or sets the equalizer filter state.
member.remarks: Reset the digital demodulation equalization filter state. This method is ignored if the equalization filter is not turned on ( set to False). For more information, see the Digital Demodulation "Using the Equalization Filter" in the VSA Application help.

member.name: M:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.RecallStateDefinitionsFile(System.String)
member.summary: Recall state definition mappings from a file.
member.param: The state definition file to recall.
member.remarks: Recalls the digital demodulation state definitions from a file. You can recall a state definition file that was originally created for the 89400 analyzer or 89601A Vector Signal Analyzer. The file contains lines that define the constellation state to symbol bit mapping for the different modulation formats.

member.name: M:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.Preset(Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.Standard)
member.summary: Set the digital demodulation properties based upon the specified standard.
member.remarks: This method lets you select a digital-demodulation standard setups. Selecting a standard configures the properties of to match that standard. For example, specifying configures the analyzer to demodulate NADC signals.

member.name: M:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.PresetStateDefinitions
member.summary: Set the current state definitions mappings to default values.
member.remarks: Restores the digital demodulation measurement constellation state definitions to the default Values.

member.name: M:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.GetSyncPattern(System.String)
member.summary: Provides the binary pattern for the specified sync search pattern name.
member.param: Name of sync search pattern to retrieve.
member.returns: Binary pattern for the specified sync search pattern name.

member.name: M:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.SetSyncPattern(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the binary pattern for the specified sync search pattern name.
member.param: Name of sync search pattern to retrieve.
Binary pattern to set for the specified sync search pattern name.

member.name: M:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.RemoveSyncPattern(System.String)
member.summary: Remove the specified sync search pattern name.
member.param: String that names the specified sync search pattern.
member.returns: True if the pattern is successfully removed, false otherwise

member.name: M:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.RemoveAllSyncPatterns
member.summary: Remove all sync search pattern names.
member.remarks: This method removes all named sync search patterns. Use to name sync search patterns.

member.name: M:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.ValidateUserFilter(Agilent.SA.Vsa.DataRegister)
member.summary: For digital demodulation, you can use data registers to create your own user-defined filter for the measurement or reference filter. You can use this property to see if a data register contains a valid filter definition. To have a valid filter definition, a data register must contain a valid, non-empty, complex, time-domain trace.
member.returns: UserFilterValidation.Valid if the specified data register contains a Valid filter definition; otherwise a different UserFilterValidation enumeration value.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.ApskRing2Ratio
member.summary: Gets or sets the ratio between the second APSK ring radius and the inner ring radius.
member.remarks: APSK R2 / R1 determines the Ring 2 to Ring 1 ratio for APSK format measurements.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.ApskRing3Ratio
member.summary: Gets or sets the ratio between the 3rd APSK ring radius and the inner ring radius.
member.remarks: APSK R3 / R1 determines the Ring 3 to Ring 1 ratio for APSK format measurements.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.ClockAdjustment
member.summary: Gets or sets the clock adjustment (in Symbols).
member.remarks: The ClockAdjust property determines when the analyzer's digital demodulator samples the I/Q trajectory. Minimum Value: -0.5 symbols Maximum Value: +0.5 symbols The digital demodulator used in this analyzer does not require symbol-clock timing signals to determine the location of symbols (detection decision points). Instead, the digital demodulator uses an algorithm to determine symbol locations. Some digital communications systems contain nonlinearities that can bias the digital demodulator's estimation of the symbol clock position. You can use ClockAdjust to compensate for this "offset" and obtain a lower EVM (Error Vector Magnitude).

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.CpmIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the {h1, h2} values for CPM.
member.remarks: This value is ignored if is true.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.EqualizerMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the run mode of the Adaptive Equalizer.
member.remarks: Determine whether the adaptive equalizer of the digital demodulation is currently running. To use the adaptive equalizer, it must be turned on ( set to true) and must be set to . You can set the equalizer to stop adapting and hold its current filter by setting to . You can equalize to start over from its initial state by calling . For more information, see Digital Demodulation "About Adaptive Equalization" topic in the VSA Application help.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.EqualizerConvergence
member.summary: Gets or sets the convergence parameter for the Adaptive Equalizer
member.remarks: Controls the rate of convergence of the adaptive equalizer of the digital demodulation measurement. Convergence determines how quickly the equalization filter coefficients converge to the estimated Values for each measurement. Larger values converge faster. This provides a trade-off in the number of measurements required for convergence of the equalization filter taps, and the stability of those taps. This property is only useful if the adaptive equalizer is on (). Default Value: 1e-07. For more, see Digital Demodulation "Convergence (equalization)" topic in the VSA Application help.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.EqualizerFilterLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of the equalization filter, in symbols.
member.remarks: Specifies the length of the adaptive equalization filter of the digital demodulation measurement. The value is specified as an odd whole number of symbols. This property is only applied if the adaptive equalizer is enabled (). For more information, see the Digital Demodulation "Using the Equalization Filter" topic in the VSA Application help.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.FilterAlphaBT
member.summary: Gets or sets the α (alpha) or BT (bandwidth time product) parameter for measurement and reference filters.
member.remarks: The α (alpha) parameter determines the filter characteristics of the Nyquist (or Raised Cosine) filters used by the digital demodulator. The BT (bandwidth time product) parameter determines the filter characteristics of the Gaussian filters used by the digital demodulator. For more information about filter characteristics, see the Digital Demodulation "Alpha/BT" topic in the VSA Applications help. For more information about digital demodulation measurements, see the Digital Demodulation "Setting up a Digital Demod Measurement" topic in the VSA Application help.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.FskDeviationReference
member.summary: Gets or sets FSK frequency deviation reference value. This property is ignored unless the format is set to FSK2, FSK4, FSK8 or FSK16. It is also ignored when FSK demod automatically determines the frequency deviation reference.
member.remarks: This property is ignored except when the Format is set to Fsk2, Fsk4, Fsk8, or Fsk16. It is also ignored when is true. When is false, this property specifies the frequency deviation reference level, which is used to construct the FSK Ref Time trace.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.Format
member.summary: Gets or sets the digital modulation format used by the signal under test.
member.remarks: The digital modulation format is a fundamental parameter in defining modulation analysis. The selected format will determine what other modulation analysis properties are available. The selected format will also determine what trace data is available for display, what data is presented on those traces, and how those traces are labeled and presented. For more information about digital demodulation measurements, see the Digital Demodulation "Setting up a Digital Demod Measurement" topic in the VSA Application help.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.IsCpmIndexAuto
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether CPM (Continuous Phase Modulation) values for {h1, h2} (modulation index values) are auto-detected.
member.remarks: Applies to the digital modulation format. If true, the demodulator automatically determines the H1 and H2 modulator indices and is ignored. If false, then is used to determine the H1 and H2 modulation indices.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.IsCustomApskPhaseShiftNotUniform
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether Custom APSK demodulation will use a non-uniform phase shift definition.
member.remarks: This property only applies when is set to , and a single ring is enabled with 4 or 6 states. When set to true, the resulting Custom APSK constellation will use the specified Phase Offset value for the first state. For 6 state case, the second and fifth states lie on the Q-axis. Symmetry across both axes are preserved. This constellation mapping is useful for some forms of Binary Offset Carrier modulation (like BOC{5,2}) and unbalanced QPSK.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.IsEqualized
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the equalization filter is enabled.
member.remarks: Determine whether the digital demodulation measurement uses adaptive equalization. In addition to this property, you must set to to get the adaptive equalizer to run. For more information, see Digital Demodulation "About Adaptive Equalization" topic in the VSA Application help.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.IsFrequencyMirrored
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether modulation analysis will mirror the frequency spectrum.
member.remarks: Determine whether the measured signal will be mirrored around the center frequency prior to demodulation. For a VSB ( or ) signal that uses a high-side pilot, this property must be set to true to demodulate the high-side pilot. Otherwise the demodulator cannot find and lock to the measured pilot signal. Note turning on will again mirror the frequency spectrum around the center frequency. If and are true, digital demodulation behaves as if neither of the properties is set to true.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.IsFskDeviationReferenceAutomatic
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether FSK demod automatically determines the frequency deviation reference.
member.remarks: This property is ignored except when the Format is set to Fsk2, Fsk4, Fsk8, or Fsk16. When this property is true, the FSK demodulator automatically determines the frequency deviation reference level from the measured signal. When the property is false, the frequency deviation reference is determined by the property, and the measured frequency deviation is ignored.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.IsIQImpairmentEstimationPointsPerSymbol
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether points per symbol coupling is enabled for gain imbalance and quadrature skew measurements.
member.remarks: This property controls what measurement data is included in the Quadrature Skew and IQ Gain Imbalance error parameter calculations. True uses the number of points-per-symbol specified by in the calculations. False uses the default number of Points per Symbol in calculations (the default values that the analyzer uses for points-per-symbol are shown in Digital Demodulation "Points/Symbol" topic in the VSA Application help). The default values are typically optimal, but increased sensitivity to effects occurring between symbol decision points may be more apparent by choosing to couple the measurements to points per symbol.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.IsLowSignalNoiseRatio
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the low SNR enhancement mode for PSK and QAM signals is enabled.
member.remarks: Typically this should be set to false. However, in some cases noise causes loss of synchronization in the demodulation measurement. In these cases, setting this to true may provide a more robust measurement.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.IsNormalized
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the measurement results present IQ data normalized to the ideal IQ state positions.
member.remarks: This affects the presentation of modulation analysis results, but does not alter the digital demodulator.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.IsOffsetQpskIQAligned
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether Offset QPSK demodulation will align the I and Q parts of IQ Meas Time and IQ Ref Time
member.remarks: This property only applies when is set to . When set to true, the resulting IQ Meas Time And IQ Ref Time no longer show what was actually transmitted. Instead the symbol points better represent the amount of "Offset EVM" in the signal. This alignment does not affect the scalar metrics computed by the analyzer (RMS EVM, RMS Mag Error, etc.), nor does it affect other trace results like Error Vector Time. However, the IQ Meas Spectrum And IQ Ref Spectrum traces will change, because they are directly computed from IQ Meas Time And IQ Ref Time.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.IsPulseSearchEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether pulse search is enabled.
member.remarks: Determine whether the digital demodulation measurement will search for a pulse (an RF envelope) to find the beginning of the data. Digital communication systems often use pulsed transmissions to send and receive information in bursts. The carrier turns on when the transmitter transmits data; it turns off when the transmitter finishes transmitting data. If pulse search is on, the analyzer searches within the defined search length () to locate the first complete pulse. For more information, see the Digital Modulation "Pulse Search" topic in the VSA Application help.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.IsUserReferenceFilterLikeHalfSine
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user-defined reference filter for Offset QPSK uses Half-Sine pulse shaping.
member.remarks: This parameter applies only when is set to and a user-defined reference filter is used. The parameter indicates that the user-defined reference filter is a Half-Sine filter, or is similar enough to a Half-Sine filter that the transmitted signal has nearly constant amplitude. The parameter modifies the synchronization algorithms used by the demodulator.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.IsFilteredByReceiver
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the demodulator treats the measured signal as filtered prior to analysis.
member.remarks: Applies to the MSK Type 1 modulation format (). If true, the analyzer uses a non-standard, more robust demodulator algorithm to lock to signals that have been filtered by a receiver prior to the analyzer input. If false, the analyzer uses the standard demodulator algorithm which may fail to lock. This is typically only required when measuring a signal within a receiver (such as provided by a logic analyzer connection to an RFIC).

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.IsConstellationSyncSearchEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether sync search is enabled.
member.remarks: Determine whether constellation sync search is enabled for the digital demodulation measurement. When true, determines the pattern to search for in the input data, and determines where in the demodulated symbols the pattern should be located. The search process consists of demodulating the data at the different possible ideal constellation phase offsets, and aligning the symbols with the data pattern. If the data pattern cannot be found, a trace indicator of "SYNC NOT FOUND" is displayed.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.MeasurementFilter
member.summary: Gets or sets the measurement filter applied during the digital demodulation measurement.
member.remarks: Determines the type of digital demodulation measurement filter to apply. If the measurement filter is , then the filter is constructed from the data register specified by . Details about digital demodulation filtering are available in the "About Filters" topic in the VSA Applications help.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.MeasurementFilterRegister
member.summary: Gets or sets the data register to use for the user-defined measurement filter.
member.remarks: This determines the data register to use for generating the digital demodulation measurement filter. This only applies when is set to . To contain a valid measurement filter, the data register must be a valid, non-empty, real, time domain trace. Validity can be checked by calling .

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.NormalizationReference
member.summary: Gets or sets the reference used for normalization of IQ traces and EVM calculations.
member.remarks: This applies to QAM and APSK modulation formats, but not FSK or VSB. When IsNormalized is true, this normalization reference is used for all IQ traces and EVM results. When IsNormalized is false, this normalization reference is still used for EVM results.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.PointsPerSymbol
member.summary: Gets or sets the points per symbol generated in the demod measurement data.
member.remarks: Determine the number of output points per symbol generated by the digital demodulation measurement for the IQ/FSK measured time and IQ/FSK reference time results. The allowable Values are: 1, 2, 4, 5, 10, and 20 points/symbol.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.ReferenceFilter
member.summary: Gets or sets the reference filter applied during the digital demodulation measurement.
member.remarks: Determines the type of digital demodulation reference filter to apply. If the reference filter is , then the filter is constructed from the data register specified by . Details about digital demodulation filtering are available in the "About Filters" topic in the VSA Applications help.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.ReferenceFilterRegister
member.summary: Gets or sets the data register to use for the user-defined reference filter.
member.remarks: This determines the data register to use for generating the digital demodulation reference filter. This only applies when is set to . To contain a valid reference filter, the data register must be a valid, non-empty, real, time domain trace. Validity can be checked by calling .

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.ResultLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the demod measurement result length (in symbols).
member.remarks: This is used to determine the number of symbols to demodulate.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.SearchLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the search length (in seconds) for the digital demodulation measurement.
member.remarks: Determines the amount of data over which a search is performed when or is true.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.StarQamRing2Ratio
member.summary: Gets or sets the ratio between the second Star-QAM ring radius and the inner ring radius.
member.remarks: Determines the Ring 2 to Ring 1 ratio for Star-QAM format measurements. Only applies to and

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.StarQamRing3Ratio
member.summary: Gets or sets the ratio between the 3rd Star-QAM ring radius and the inner ring radius.
member.remarks: Determines the Ring 3 to Ring 1 ratio for Star-QAM format measurements. Only applies to

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.StarQamRing4Ratio
member.summary: Gets or sets the ratio between the fourth Star-QAM ring radius and the inner ring radius.
member.remarks: Determines the Ring 4 to Ring 1 ratio for Star-QAM format measurements. Only applies to

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.StateDefinitionLines
member.summary: Gets the text description of the current state definitions.
member.remarks:
Returns the current ideal IQ state definition as a string. This is the same information that is specified in a CSD (Constellation State Definitions) file if you elect to recall custom state definitions with . For most demodulation formats, the state definitions table represents the constellation diagram, and returns the bit definitions for each symbol in the constellation diagram. For example, if the current demodulation format is QAM 16, the StateDefinitionLines property will return a string similar to the following, which shows the bit definitions for each state in the QAM constellation diagram:
0011
0010
0001
0000
0111
0110
0101
0100
1011
1010
1001
1000
1111
1110
1101
1100
Each line is separation by a Carriage Return / Line Feed and each state on a line is separated by two spaces.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.SymbolRate
member.summary: Gets or sets the demodulator symbol rate (Hz).
member.remarks: Determines the input symbol rate, in Hertz, for the digital demodulation measurement. The input channels determine the maximum symbol rate that the analyzer can accurately measure. The analyzer can accurately measure symbol rates that are less than the maximum span of the selected input. For more information, see the Digital Demodulation "Setting up a Measurement" topic in the VSA Application help.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.SyncOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the sync search offset (in symbols).
member.remarks: Determines the location of result length within search length. You can specify a positive or negative offset. If the occurs before the start of result length, specify a negative offset. If it occurs after the start of result length, specify a positive offset. Applies only when is true.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.ActiveSyncPattern
member.summary: Gets or sets the sync search binary pattern.
member.remarks:
A string of 1's and 0's to use as the synchronization pattern for sync search during digital demodulation.
Minimum length: 1 Symbol
Maximum length: 32 symbols The pattern must be entered as binary digits. Characters other than one ('1') and zero ('0') are ignored. Only applies if is true.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.SyncPatternNames
member.summary: Gets a list of names of currently available sync search pattern names.
member.remarks: Returns an array of strings containing the names of all named sync search patterns. can be used to retrieve the pattern associated with each pattern name. can be used to iterate through the collection of patterns.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.UserRotate
member.summary: Gets or sets the demod user rotation value (in degrees).
member.remarks: Rotates the Meas/Ref Time data and corresponding ideal state positions 0 to 360 degrees.

member.name: P:Agilent.SA.Vsa.DigitalDemod.MeasurementExtension.CustomApskRings
member.summary: Gets the collection of objects representing the Custom APSK per-ring settings.
